result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory G. Goodbear was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gregory G. Goodbear in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Gregory G. Goodbear in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State gives recommendation.  Attorney Tsai agrees.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 1:
$243.00 costs & $200.00 DNA surcharge, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
43 Days in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive. 43 days credit.
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Gregory G. Goodbear in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Gregory G. Goodbear in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request reset for next week.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Gregory G. Goodbear in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Gregory G. Goodbear in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State request to tomorrow.  Further discussion needed.  Return date scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on March 27, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Return date on April 8, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Gregory G. Goodbear by video from LEC with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Gregory G. Goodbear in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Tsai responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $400.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times and not to go to the House of Wellness.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 09:45 am.  Return date scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
